engines: 5.7L V8 LS1 (325 hp Trans Am WS6)
notes: Final years fourth-generation Firebird (1993-2002). F-body platform. Trans Am with LS1 V8. WS6 Ram Air performance package. Production ended 2002. Timing chain engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Firebird article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth-generation Pontiac Grand Am final years (1999-2005). N-body front-wheel drive. GT and SE trim levels. Timing chain engines. Discontinued 2005. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Grand Am article, January 2025 revision.

Eighth-generation Pontiac Grand Prix (2004-2008). W-body front-wheel drive. GTP supercharged 3800 Series III, GXP with LS4 V8. Timing chain engines. Final Grand Prix generation. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Grand Prix article, January 2025 revision.

Final generation Pontiac Bonneville (2000-2005). G-body front-wheel drive full-size sedan. GXP with Cadillac Northstar V8. Timing chain engines. Discontinued 2005. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Bonneville article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac Vibe compact wagon (2003-2010). NUMMI joint venture with Toyota, based on Corolla Matrix. E120/E140 platform. AWD available. Timing chain engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Vibe article, January 2025 revision.

Modern Pontiac GTO revival (2004-2006). Rebadged Holden Monaro from Australia. Zeta platform. LS1/LS2 V8 engines. Limited production run. Timing chain engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac GTO article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac G6 mid-size car (2005-2010). Epsilon platform, Grand Am replacement. GXP performance variant. Convertible hardtop retractable. Timing chain engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac G6 article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac Solstice roadster (2006-2009). Kappa platform shared with Saturn Sky. Rear-wheel drive sports car. GXP turbo variant. Timing chain engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Solstice article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac Torrent crossover SUV (2006-2009). Theta platform shared with Chevy Equinox. AWD available. Timing chain V6 engines. Discontinued with Pontiac brand. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac Torrent article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac G5 compact coupe (2007-2009). Delta platform, rebadged Chevy Cobalt. GT performance package. Timing chain I4 engines. Canada also had sedan variant. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac G5 article, January 2025 revision.

Pontiac G8 performance sedan (2008-2009). Rebadged Holden Commodore VE from Australia. Zeta platform. LS3 V8 in GXP. Timing chain engines. Discontinued with brand. Data sourced from Wikipedia Pontiac G8 article, January 2025 revision.
